*A cross-national comparison*

*Higher coefficients indicate a stronger relationship between racial resentment and self left-right ideological placement*

*Method: Linear regression*

```{r code, include=FALSE}
### Import data

library(shiny)
library(ggplot2)
library(tidyverse)
library(ggrepel)
library(survey)
library(rvest)
library(plyr)
library(broom)
library(knitr)
library(RCurl)
library(stargazer)

W_EVS <- read.csv("W_EVS_clean.csv")

# Split into list by country-wave

cw_list <- W_EVS %>% dlply('country_wave')

## Modeling

lapply(cw_list, function(x) {
  filter(x, !is.na(self_ideo) & !is.na(RacRes_n))
}) %>% 
  .[sapply(., function(x) {
    dim(x)[1] > 0
  })] %>% 
  lapply(function(x) {
  model <- lm(self_ideo ~ RacRes_n, data = x, weights = S017)
  return(data.frame(Coefficients = model$coefficients[2]))
}) %>% 
  do.call(rbind.data.frame, .) -> coeff.tab

OLS.tab <- coeff.tab[order(coeff.tab$Coefficients, decreasing = T), , drop = F]
```

```{r echo=FALSE, results='asis'}
kable(OLS.tab)
```
